name: Cox's Bazar
description: Cox's Bazar is known for having the longest uninterrupted natural sandy sea beach in the world.

name: Dhaka City
description: Dhaka is the capital and largest city of Bangladesh, known for its vibrant culture, history, and bustling streets.

name: Panam city
description: Panam City is a historical site in Bangladesh known for its well-preserved ancient architecture and ruins.

name: Lalbag Killa
description: Lalbag Killa is an incomplete Mughal fort complex in Dhaka, notable for its historical significance and architectural beauty.

name: Khaiachara Waterfall
description: Khaiachara Waterfall is a picturesque natural waterfall nestled in the hills of Bangladesh, offering a serene and refreshing experience.

name: Saint Martin
description: Saint Martin's Island is a popular tourist destination known for its stunning beaches, crystal-clear waters, and vibrant marine life.

name: Sundarban
description: The Sundarbans is the largest mangrove forest in the world and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, home to diverse flora and fauna, including the Bengal tiger.

name: Rajshahi City
description: Rajshahi is a city known for its rich history, archaeological sites, and vibrant cultural heritage, situated on the northern banks of the Padma River.

name: Kaptai Lake
description: Kaptai Lake is the largest man-made lake in Bangladesh, surrounded by lush green hills and offering scenic boat rides.

name: Ahsan Manjil
description: Ahsan Manjil is a historical palace in Dhaka, once the residence of the Nawab family and now a museum showcasing Bangladeshi history and culture.

name: Maheshkhali
description: Maheshkhali is a picturesque hill island near Cox's Bazar, known for its scenic beauty, ancient temples, and traditional handicrafts.

name: Panchagar
description: Panchagarh is a district in the Rangpur Division of Bangladesh, known for its natural beauty, including hills, rivers, and forests.

name: Bandarban
description: Bandarban is a hill district in southeastern Bangladesh, famous for its lush green hills, tribal culture, and adventure tourism.

name: Guliakhali Sea Beach
description: Guliakhali Sea Beach is a serene and less crowded beach in Bangladesh, offering breathtaking views of the Bay of Bengal and tranquil surroundings.

name: Mahasthangar
description: Mahasthangarh is an ancient archaeological site in Bogura District, believed to be the oldest city in Bangladesh and an important cultural and historical landmark.

name: Madhabkundo Waterfall
description: Madhabkunda Waterfall is the largest waterfall in Bangladesh, surrounded by lush green forests and offering a mesmerizing natural spectacle.

name: Srimangal
description: Srimangal is a scenic hill town in northeastern Bangladesh, renowned for its tea gardens, biodiversity, and tranquil ambiance.

name: Mayabi Waterfall
description: Mayabi Waterfall is a hidden gem nestled in the forests of Bangladesh, offering a serene and refreshing escape from the bustling city life.

name: Kuakata Sea Beach
description: Kuakata Sea Beach is a pristine beach located in the Patuakhali district of Bangladesh, famous for its panoramic sunrise and sunset views.

name: Sajek
description: Sajek Valley is a popular hill resort in Bangladesh, known for its breathtaking natural beauty, indigenous communities, and adventurous trekking trails.
